summary: This is an email chain from May 26, 2020, regarding a request from a U.S. Attorney's office for a contractor to create video clips from the deposition videos of Ghislaine Maxwell in connection with the Epstein investigation. The request specifies 11 question and answer sequences from her deposition, with the videos stored on a shared government server.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the deposition videos from which specific Q&A sequences are to be clipped for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Request for Maxwell Deposition Video Clips
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's office requests a contractor to create video clips from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition videos, specifying 11 Q&A sequences for use in the Epstein investigation.

locations: Usa.doj.gov \ cloud\NYS StAndrews\Shared\USvEpstein-2018R01618 InvestigationVI 2018 SDNY investigation\Subpoena Rett na)202 05-02, third subpoena response\Videos
keyFacts: The document is a 2020 email chain showing ongoing investigative work related to the Epstein case, specifically concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition.
A U.S. Attorney's office requested the creation of video clips from Maxwell's deposition, targeting approximately 11 specific question and answer sequences.
The deposition videos were stored on a U.S. Department of Justice cloud server under a path related to the 'USvEpstein-2018R01618' investigation and a third subpoena response.
The request specifies including about 30 seconds before and after each relevant exchange to provide full context.
The email correspondents' names and the specific Assistant U.S. Attorney are redacted in the provided text.
